UI_visible_response: “Wolf Warrior Diplomacy” is a metaphorical phrase denoting a new demeanor of Chinese diplomats, characterized by particular assertiveness and aggressiveness1. It describes an aggressive style of coercive diplomacy adopted by Chinese diplomats in the 21st century under Chinese leader, serving as propaganda to oppose any external threats and criticisms which are considered key challenges3. This form of diplomacy addresses domestic political climate, world power dynamics, and national interests using authoritative language, nationalism4. The emergence of “wolf warrior diplomats” symbolises the incursion of cyber-nationalist preferences for a hard-edged foreign policy posture6.
traffic_visible_response: “Wolf Warrior Diplomacy” is a metaphorical phrase denoting a new demeanor of Chinese diplomats, characterized by particular assertiveness and aggressiveness [[1]]. It describes an aggressive style of coercive diplomacy adopted by Chinese diplomats in the 21st century under Chinese leader, serving as propaganda to oppose any external threats and criticisms which are considered key challenges [[3]]. This form of diplomacy addresses domestic political climate, world power dynamics, and national interests using authoritative language, nationalism [[4]]. The emergence of “wolf warrior diplomats” symbolises the incursion of cyber-nationalist preferences for a hard-edged foreign policy posture [[6]].
